ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] audiometricTestingDate with data type Point In Time
The DATE OF AUDIOMETRIC TESTING when actual testing was done or the DATE OF AUDIOMETRIC TESTING from a past visit when testing is not done on the current date.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold2000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 2000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold3000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 3000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftNu6Score with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's (Left) word recognition score for NU-6 Material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftCidW22Score with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's (Left) word recognition score for CID W-22 material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold4000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 4000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThresholdAverage with data type Integer
This is the average pure tone threshold for this patient's Left ear. This indicates the average of the 1000, 2000, 3000 and 4000Hz scores for the Left ear.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold1000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 1000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold500Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's pure tone threshold (Left) at 500Hz. Used in determining whether or not a ratable hearing loss exists.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftCncScore with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's (Left) word recognition score for Maryland CNC material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold4000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Right) at 4000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightNu6Score with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's (Right) word recognition score for NU-6 Material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold1000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Right) at 1000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold500Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's pure tone threshold (Right) at 500Hz. Used in determining whether or not a ratable hearing loss exists.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold3000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Right) at 3000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightCidW22Score with data type Integer
Indiates the patient's (Right) word recognition score for CID W-22 material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightCncScore with data type Integer
Indicates the patient's (Right) word recognition score for Maryland CNC material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold2000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Right) at 2000Hz for this patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThresholdAverage with data type Integer
This is the average pure tone threshold for this patient's right ear. This indicates the average of the 1000, 2000, 3000 and 4000Hz scores for the right ear.

Contains exactly one [1..1] audiometricTestingDate with data type Point In Time
The DATE OF AUDIOMETRIC TESTING when actual testing was done or the DATE OF AUDIOMETRIC TESTING from a past visit when testing is not done on the current date.

Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 2000Hz for this patient.

Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 3000Hz for this patient.

Indicates the patient's (Left) word recognition score for NU-6 Material.

Indicates the patient's (Left) word recognition score for CID W-22 material.

Contains exactly one [1..1] leftThreshold4000Hz with data type Integer
Indicates the pure tone threshold (Left) at 4000Hz for this patient.

This is the average pure tone threshold for this patient's Left ear. This indicates the average of the 1000, 2000, 3000 and 4000Hz scores for the Left ear.

Indicates the patient's pure tone threshold (Left) at 500Hz. Used in determining whether or not a ratable hearing loss exists.

Indicates the patient's pure tone threshold (Right) at 500Hz. Used in determining whether or not a ratable hearing loss exists.

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightThreshold3000Hz with data type Integer

Contains exactly one [1..1] rightCidW22Score with data type Integer
